p: To further include head-specific cross-reactive epitopes into consideration for universal vaccine design, Krammer and Palese proposed a novel concept of mosaic HAs, which were constructed by replacing the immunodominant antigenic sites in the head with sequences from exotic, avian HA subtypes, instead of changing the whole head domain (Fig. 4B) (Broecker et al. 2018; Liu et al. 2018; Krammer and Palese 2019). Such a vaccination regimen can induce antibodies targeting both conserved HA stalk and conserved epitopes in the head domain, possessing improved potential as universal vaccines (Sun et al. 2019).
